facts.fact_text: Kazuyuki Masu said further interest rate hikes will be necessary to complete Japan’s monetary policy normalization.

evidences.evidence_text: Further interest rate hikes will be necessary to complete Japan’s monetary policy normalization, central bank board member Kazuyuki Masu said in a speech on Friday.

facts.fact_text: Masu joined the Bank of Japan’s nine-member board last July.

evidences.evidence_text: The speech was Masu’s first public appearance since joining the Bank of Japan’s nine-member board last July

claims.claim_text: Raising rates would help reduce the policy divergence between Japan and other major economies.
claims.author: Masu

evidences.evidence_text: Masu noted that raising rates would help reduce the policy divergence between Japan and other major economies, a gap widely seen as a key driver of prolonged yen weakness that has pushed up import costs for businesses and households.

claims.claim_text: Timely and appropriate rate hikes are needed to keep underlying inflation below 2%.
claims.author: Masu

evidences.evidence_text: He said timely and appropriate rate hikes are needed to keep underlying inflation below 2%, while warning against raising rates too aggressively in a way that could disrupt the gradual upward trend in wages and inflation.

claims.claim_text: Raising rates too aggressively could disrupt the gradual upward trend in wages and inflation.
claims.author: Masu

evidences.evidence_text: He said timely and appropriate rate hikes are needed to keep underlying inflation below 2%, while warning against raising rates too aggressively in a way that could disrupt the gradual upward trend in wages and inflation.

claims.claim_text: Masu characterized his stance as balanced between hawkish and dovish views.
claims.author: Masu

evidences.evidence_text: when he characterized his stance as balanced between hawkish and dovish views.
